remarks.para: May be inoperative provided alternate fueling procedures are established and used.

placard.para: Placard inoperative Fueling Panel Indicator(s) "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: With the load select function inoperative at the external fueling station, automatic shutdown or overfill protection may not exist.

numlitem.para: Refuel using fuel quantity gauges on the pilots overhead instrument panel.
Use the underwing fuel measuring sticks.

note.para: Fuel measuring stick readings are only approximate due to changes in aircraft attitude and fuel density.

caution.para: OBSERVE FUEL QUANTITY LIMITS FOR EACH TANK WHEN TRANSFERRING FUEL FROM ONE TANK TO THE OTHER.

numlitem.para: Determine that the tank or tanks to which the fuel is to be transferred (tank(s) with operative quantity gauge(s)) have sufficient capacity to receive the fuel from the tank(s) with the inoperative gauge(s).
Open the fueling valve for tank(s) to receive the fuel.
Turn on boost pump(s) in tank being defueled.

After the tank is emptied, re-transfer into it the desired quantity of fuel (using the operative gauge of the supplying tank for measuring), or pump in a known quantity from the refueling truck using the truck meter.
Fuel the remaining tanks to the desired quantity in the normal manner.
